name: servicenow-cmdb
label: ServiceNow CMDB
description: ServiceNow Configuration Management Database (CMDB) is a centralized source that gives you full visibility into your IT environment. By storing information about your organization's infrastructure and how it is configured, this system allows you to monitor your network and ensure stability and best performance.

fields.name: username

operations.title: Create Configuration Item
operations.description:
Creates a single configuration item (CI) with the specified outbound and inbound relations within the specified ServiceNow Configuration Management Database (CMDB) table based on the class name, discovery name, CI name, and other input parameters you have specified.
NOTE: If the CMDB class has a dependent identification rule defined, then the input payload must contain the sys_id of an existing CI. For example, for outbound_relations, the target parameter must contain the sys_id of an existing CI, which then becomes the child; whereas for inbound_relations, it becomes the parent.

parameters.title: Class Name
parameters.description: Specify the class name of the configuration management database (CMDB) table in which you want to create the new configuration item (CI). This is the name of the table that contains the desired CI records, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server, cmdb_ci_apache_web_server, etc.
parameters.name: class_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the class name of the configuration management database (CMDB) table in which you want to create configuration item (CI). This is the name of the table that contains the desired CI records, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_apache_web_server, etc.

parameters.title: Discovery Source
parameters.description: Select a discovery source of the configuration item (CI) you want to create in the CMDB table. You can choose from the options such as ACC- Visibility, AgentClientCollector, Altiris, Cloud Insights Billing, etc.
parameters.name: source
parameters.tooltip: Select a discovery source of the configuration item (CI) you want to create in the CMDB table. You can choose from the options such as ACC- Visibility, AgentClientCollector, Altiris, Cloud Insights Billing, etc.

parameters.title: Configuration Item Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the configuration item that you want to create in the CMDB table.
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the configuration item that you want to create in the CMDB table.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a brief description of the configuration item you want to create in the CMDB table.
parameters.name: short_description
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify a brief description of the configuration item you want to create in the CMDB table.

parameters.title: Attributes
parameters.description:
(Optional) Specify the data attributes of the configuration item you want to create in the CMDB table. The available attributes depend on the specified CMDB class.
You can locate the available attributes in the associated CMDB table, which typically begins with "cmdb_ci", such as cmdb_ci_linux_server, cmdb_ci_mfp_printer, etc. For referenced type attributes, specify the sys_id, of that particular attribute. The "sys_id" can be retrieved by making an API call using the "Custom API Endpoint" action.
parameters.name: attributes
parameters.tooltip:
(Optional) Specify the data attributes of the configuration item you want to create in the CMDB table. The available attributes depend on the specified CMDB class.
You can locate the available attributes in the associated CMDB table, which typically begins with "cmdb_ci", such as cmdb_ci_linux_server, cmdb_ci_mfp_printer, etc. For referenced type attributes, specify the sys_id, of that particular attribute. The "sys_id" can be retrieved by making an API call using the "Custom API Endpoint" action.

operations.title: Get Configuration Items
operations.description: Retrieves the available configuration items (CI) for a specific ServiceNow Configuration Management Database (CMDB) class (table) based on the class name, query, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Class Name
parameters.description: Specify the class name of the configuration management database (CMDB) table from which you want to retrieve available configuration items (CI). This is the name of the table that contains the desired CI records, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server, cmdb_ci_apache_web_server, etc.
parameters.name: class_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the class name of the configuration management database (CMDB) table from which you want to retrieve available configuration items (CI). This is the name of the table that contains the desired CI records, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server, cmdb_ci_apache_web_server, etc.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify a query using which you can filter the available configuration items (CI) for the specified Configuration Management Database (CMDB) table.
parameters.name: sysparm_query
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a query using which you can filter the available configuration items (CI) for the specified Configuration Management Database (CMDB) table. Syntax: <col_name><operator><value> For e.g. javascript:gs.getUserID()^active=true, etc.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results, that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 1000.
parameters.name: sysparm_limit
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results, that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 1000.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful for pagination and for getting a subset of items, say CIs starting from the 10th CI. By default, this is set as 0.

parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful for pagination and for getting a subset of items, say CIs starting from the 10th CI. By default, this is set as 0.

operations.title: Add Relation to Configuration Item
operations.description: Adds an inbound and/or outbound relation to the specified configuration item (CI) in the specified ServiceNow Configuration Management Database (CMDB) table based on the class name, system ID, discovery name, and other input parameters you have specified. NOTE: The specified configuration item will act as the parent or the relation.
